intro: Elaeosticta chitralica, commonly known as the Chitral bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Elaeosticta chitralica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
